subject: Psychology
title: The Contact Hypothesis
description: A 60-second lesson on The Contact Hypothesis.

hook.text: Segregated groups feared each other for decades. Then they worked on a shared goal and prejudice faded.

buildup.text: Gordon Allport proposed that contact between groups reduces prejudice ‚Äî but only under the right conditions.

discovery.text: The conditions: equal status, shared goals, cooperation, and support from authorities.

twist.text: Without these conditions, contact can actually increase prejudice. Mere exposure to another group isn't enough.

climax.text: Structured, cooperative contact remains one of the most effective tools for reducing intergroup hostility.

punchline.text: Contact alone isn't enough. The conditions of contact matter.

quiz.question: What does the contact hypothesis require to reduce prejudice?
options: Equal status, shared goals, cooperation, and authority support
